post.summary:
Register a new account and creates an associated user.
            Requires the {PlayGen.SUGAR.Contracts.Shared.AccountRequest.Name} to be unique.
            Returns a JsonWebToken used for authorization in any further calls to the API.
            
            Example Usage: POST api/account/create

parameters.name: accountRequest
parameters.description: {PlayGen.SUGAR.Contracts.Shared.AccountRequest} object that contains the details of the new Account.

parameters.description: {PlayGen.SUGAR.Contracts.Shared.AccountRequest} object that contains the details of the new Account.

get.summary:
Method for admins to creates a match for a game they are not logged into.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/create/1

Method to create a match for a game a user is currently logged into
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/create

Method to create a match for a game a user is currently logged into which is also started automatically.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/create

Start a match for the game the user is currently logged into.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/1/start

Ends a match for the game that the user is currently logged in for.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/1/end

Method for admins to end a match for a game they are not logged into.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/1/end

Get a list of matches filtered by a time range.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/2016-12-20T15:40:30/2016-12-20T16:50:40

Get a list of matches for a specific game.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/game/1

Get a list of matches for a specific game, filtered by a time range.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/game/1/2016-12-20T15:40:30/2016-12-20T16:50:40

Get a list of matches that were created by a specific actor.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/creator/1

Get a list of matches that were created by a specific actor, filtered by a time range.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/creator/1/2016-12-20T15:40:30/2016-12-20T16:50:40

Get a list of matches for a specific game created by a specific actor.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/game/1/creator/1

Get a list of matches for a specific game created by a specific user, filtered by a time range.
            
            Example Usage: GET api/match/game/1/creator/1/2016-12-20T15:40:30/2016-12-20T16:50:40

get.summary:
Heartbeat method to keep the specific session alive.
            Calling it within a server defined interval will notify the server that the
            session is still active.

Logsout the currently logged in account, ending it's session and removing the 
            authorization token.

sourceToken.description: The source from which the user is trying to log-in.

requiresPassword.description: Whether the user needs to pass a password when logging in via this source

token.description: A unique identifier used in development to reference the achievement/skill.

gameId.description: The ID of the Game which this achievement/skill should belong to. Can be left null to make the achievement/skill system-wide.

name.description: The display name for the achievement/skill.

actorType.description: The type of actor which this achievement/skill is intended to be completed by.

evaluationCriterias.description:
A list of criteria which will be checked in order to see if an actor has completed the achievement/skill.
            Must contain at least one criteria.

rewards.description:
A list of rewards that will be provided to the actor upon completion of the achievement/skill criteria.
            An achievement does not need to contain a reward.

EvaluationCriteriaCreateRequest.description: Encapsulates requirements for completing an achievement or skill.

RewardCreateRequest.description: Encapsulates the reward given for completing an achievement or skill.

id.description: The unqiue identifier for the achievement/skill.

token.description: A unique identifier used in development to reference the achievement/skill.

gameId.description: The ID of the Game which this achievement/skill should belong to. Can be left null to make the achievement/skill system-wide.

name.description: The display name for the achievement/skill.

actorType.description: The type of actor which this achievement/skill is intended to be completed by.

evaluationCriterias.description:
A list of criteria which will be checked in order to see if an actor has completed the achievement/skill.
            Must contain at least one criteria.

rewards.description:
A list of rewards that will be provided to the actor upon completion of the achievement/skill criteria.
            An achievement does not need to contain a reward.

EvaluationCriteriaUpdateRequest.description: Encapsulates requirements for completing an achievement or skill.

id.description: The unqiue identifier for this type.

RewardUpdateRequest.description: Encapsulates the reward given for completing an achievement or skill.

id.description: The unqiue identifier for this type.

actorId.description: The ID of the actor related to this actorclaim.

claimId.description: The ID of the claim related to this actorclaim.

entityId.description: The ID of the entity (game, actor etc) related to this actorclaim.

actorId.description: The id of the Actor which this ActorData/GameData is being ensigned to. Can be left null to ensign to the system/game.

gameId.description: The id of the Game which this ActorData/GameData relates to. Can be left null to relate the ActorData/GameData to the wider system.

key.description: The identifier of the data being stored.

value.description: The value of the data being stored.

saveDataType.description: The type of data which is being stored.

actorId.description: The ID of the actor related to this actorrole.

roleId.description: The ID of the role related to this actorrole.

entityId.description: The ID of the entity (game, actor etc) related to this actorrole.

name.description: The display name for the game.
The display name of the user/group.

requestorId.description: The Id of the requesting actor.

acceptorId.description: The Id of the receiving actor.

autoAccept.description: Whether the request should be automatically accepted.

RelationshipStatusUpdate.description: Encapsulates relationship details, including updated status of the relationship.

requestorId.description: The Id of the requesting actor.

acceptorId.description: The Id of the receiving actor.

accepted.description: Whether the request was accepted or declined.

token.description: A unique identifier used in development to reference the leaderboard.

gameId.description:
The Id of the Game which this leaderboards belongs to. Can be left null to relate this leaderboard to the system rather than a game.
            This Id is also used when gathering GameData using the Key provided.

name.description: The display name of the leaderboard.

key.description: The GameData key which is checked against in order to create the leaderboard standings.

actorType.description: The type of actor which this leaderboard is intended for.

saveDataType.description: The SaveDataType of the GameData being checked against.

criteriaScope.description: Whether the criteria will be checked against the actor or relatedactors (i.e. group members, user friends).

leaderboardType.description: The method which data will be collected and sorted for this leaderboard.

leaderboardToken.description: The Token of the Leaderboard which the standings are being gathered for.

gameId.description: The Id of the Game the leaderboard. Can be left null for system-wide leaderboards.

actorId.description: The Id of an Actor. Required for getting standings for Near, Friends (user only) and Group Members (group only)

leaderboardFilterType.description: The filter for what standings will be returned.

pageLimit.description: The maximum number of results which will be returned.

pageOffset.description:
The set of results which will be returned based on the limit.
            0 returns the first set of results for Top, Friends and Group Member and the nearest range for Near.

dateStart.description:
The earliest point which data should be collected from.
            Can be left null to set no earliest point.

dateEnd.description:
The latest point which data should be collected from.
            Can be left null to gather all data up to the present time.

actorId.description: The id of the Actor which this Resource is being ensigned to. Can be left null to ensign to the system/game.

gameId.description: The id of the Game which this Resource relates to. Can be left null to relate the Resource to the wider system.

senderActorId.description: The Id of the Actor who will send this Resource. Can be left null to only give/take from the current owner.

recipientActorId.description: The Id of the Actor who will receive this Resource. Can be left null to only give/take from the current owner.

gameId.description: The Id of the Game which this Resource belongs to. Left null for system-wise resources.

quantity.description: The amount of the Resource being transferred.

key.description: The key of the Resource being transferred.

name.description: The display name for the role.

roleId.description: The ID of the role related to this roleclaim.

claimId.description: The ID of the claim related to this roleclaim.

name.description: The display name of the user/group.
